name: Generate Weekly Grocery Lists in Notion with Automated Email Notifications

user.name: Shelly-Ann Davy
user.bio:
Founder of The Workflow Muse & @SheCodesFlow.

I craft elegant, task-focused automations for creators, founders, and soft-tech enthusiasts.

‚ÄúAutomate with grace. Scale with power.‚Äù

description:
## Who‚Äôs it for
Busy homemakers, creators, and anyone who wants a simple, no-cost way to plan weekly meals and get a ready-to-shop grocery list‚Äîwithout extra apps.

## What it does
Runs on a weekly Cron schedule, generates a grocery list, creates rows in your Notion database (Ingredient, Quantity, Status), and emails the list (optional Telegram confirmation). It includes a Notion connection check, detailed error notifications (email and optional Telegram), a success email with timestamp, and optional persistent logging to a Notion ‚ÄúLogs‚Äù database.

## Requirements
- Notion account + integration connected to your database  
- SMTP credentials for the Email node  
- (Optional) Telegram bot and chat ID for alerts  
- (Optional) Notion log database if you want persistent logs

## How to set up
1. Import the workflow and open **Set: Configuration** to fill:
   - `fromEmail`, `emailTo`, `notifyEmail`, `notionDb`, `telegramChatId`  
   - (Optional) `logToNotion` (true/false), `notionLogDb`
2. In Notion, create a DB with properties:
   - **Ingredient** (Title), **Quantity** (Rich text), **Status** (Select: ‚ÄúTo Buy‚Äù)
3. Attach your **Notion** and **SMTP** credentials (and Telegram if used).
4. Run once to test, then set Cron to your preferred weekly time.

## How to customize
- Edit the recipe/grocery items in the Code node.
- Change the Cron schedule (test with ‚ÄúEvery minute,‚Äù then revert to weekly).
- Enable Telegram alerts, and/or turn on Notion logging for audit trails.

data.details: The Cron node uses Cron under the hood - a time-based job scheduler in Unix-like computer operating systems. Use this node when you want to trigger workflows periodically, especially in more complex scenarios like "every Tuesday at 9 am" or "Weekdays".

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

workflow.name: Plan weekly meals and add groceries to Notion (Cron + Email)

parameters.content:
## Who's it for
Busy homemakers, creators, and parents who want an elegant, zero-cost way to plan weekly meals.

## What it does
- Runs every Sunday at 6 PM
- Pulls a built-in list of 7 sample recipes  
- Adds ingredients to a **Notion database** grocery list  
- Emails the list (or Telegram) so you‚Äôre ready for the week

## How to set up
1. Import this workflow  
2. Add **Notion** credential ‚Üí connect your **Meal Planner** database  
3. Add **SMTP** credential (or Telegram)  
4. Activate

## Requirements
- Free Notion account  
- SMTP or Telegram credential (optional)  

## How to customize
- Change Cron day/time  
- Swap the recipe list for your own  
- Add dietary tags or portions in Notion

## Change weekly time
Open **Cron: Weekly Meal Plan (Sun 6 PM)** and set your preferred day/time.
_Tip:_ For testing, switch to **Every minute**, then set it back to **Every week** before activating.


## Reliability
This template includes a Notion connection check and simple error notifications so failures are surfaced instantly.
